xocs:funding.xocs:funding-agency: Japan Society for the Promotion of Science

head.citation-title: Hopf hypersurfaces in complex hyperbolic space and submanifolds in indefinite complex 2-plane Grassmannian I
head.abstracts: © 2015 Elsevier B.V.We define Gauss map from a real hypersurface in complex hyperbolic space to indefinite complex 2-plane Grassmannian. We show that if a real hypersurface is Hopf, then the image of the Gauss map is a half-dimensional regular submanifold and has a nice behavior under para-quaternionic Kähler structures of the Grassmannian. In particular if absolute value of the Hopf curvature of the Hopf hypersurface is greater (resp. smaller) than 2, then the Gauss image is totally complex (resp. totally para-complex) submanifold with respect to the para-quaternionic Kähler structure of indefinite complex 2-plane Grassmannian, provided that the induced metric is nondegenerate.

grant-text.$: M. Kimura was supported by JSPS KAKENHI Grant Number 24540080.

grant-agency.$: Ministry of Education, Science and Technology
Japan Society for the Promotion of Science

copyright.$: Copyright 2017 Elsevier B.V., All rights reserved.

We show that if a real hypersurface is Hopf, then the image of the Gauss map is a half-dimensional regular submanifold and has a nice behavior under para-quaternionic Kähler structures of the Grassmannian.
